instructions_to_main_agent: Use 'Cormorant Garamond' for all headings to maintain the 'Sovereign' feel.
Use 'Crimson Pro' for any text that resembles a legal document or maxim.
Ensure all backgrounds are dark (#0B1221 or #0F172A). Never use pure black or white.
Use the 'gold-glow' shadow effect on primary actions to simulate gold leaf reflection.
Implement the 'Duty-Right Explorer' using a force-directed graph where nodes are Entities and links are Duties/Rights.
For the 'Portfolio Vault', use a dense 'Control Room' grid layout with 'vault-card' components.
The 'Knowledge Base' should feel like a digital library - use the library image as a subtle background or header.
All inputs in the 'Document Editor' should look like lines on a paper contract (border-bottom only).
Use 'sonner' for all notifications (e.g., 'Document Saved to Vault').
Ensure high contrast for accessibility: Gold text is for large headers only; use off-white for body text.
universal_guidelines: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients.
Don't make generic centered layouts. Use asymmetry.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy.
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur) for overlays.
Every interaction needs micro-animations - hover states, transitions.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable.
Subtle grain textures (noise) are mandatory for the background.
All interactive elements MUST include data-testid attribute.
